Reviews.Title: “a quiet traditional hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jenny G
Reviews.Content: This family run Hotel is the best solution for people who want a quiet but central accommodation in Rome. It has its own parking spot and a small garden to relax after a hectic day in the city. Also its location is ideal, being at walking distance from Termini (5min). From this station you can reach easily every corner of the city and especially the city centre (10-15 min) with buses and subways. It is also true that from this Hotel you can walk to the Spanish steps in 25-30min. The owners are really friendly and always helpful in suggesting what to see, where to eat and shop in Rome. Our room was comfortable and recently renewed. It was clean, had air condition and free internet. In addition, this Hotel offers a big buffet breakfast, with a lot of choices of bread, egg, ham and cheese among others food type. We booked through internet and we got a fair price for our stay during the Easter week-end. As we were leaving in the evening, the staff was so nice to store our luggage until our departure hour and book us a taxi for the airport. In general, we really enjoyed our permanence in this friendly, comfortable and charming Hotel. Definitively a place to go back the next time we visit Rome!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near central station termini and city center”
Reviews.Author: Anna Maria Novi... F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Villa delle Rose end of february this year. The hotel was reccomeded us by a couple of friends as a nice small hotel runs by a family. And this is actually what we got: the hotel was nice and very clean, the room large enough to accomodate all our belongings and moreover it was recently renovated. We asked for a quiet room (Rome can be quite a noisy city!) and they gave us a room facing the hotel small garden and courtyard: it was silent and we slept very well. The breakfast was nice,buffet style and with several choises. The hotel staff was friendly and they give us lot of useful touristic info and well appreciated advices on restourants and food places. Finally, the position was really convenient: walking distance (200 mt) from the Termini station with buses for any directions and underground (it took us only 10/15 minutes to go to piazza di Spagna) and we could also get there by foot. The price we think was fair: not cheap but not expensive either. We would say we had good value for our money. And the wireless was free!

Reviews.Title: “hotel villa delle Rose”
Reviews.Author: mami032
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I wanted look for another hotel but most were already booked. The available ones were way beyond our budget. So we stayed in the hotel anyway. When we arrived, the staff at the front desk was very kind efficient despite his age. The hotel itself needs some renovation. We booked a family room for 5 persons and we were given 2 adjoining rooms which was good as we had 2 bathrooms. We found the bathrooms clean, no molds as described by other guests but the ref was moldy, so we did not use it. We did not need it though as it was chilly and nothing needed refrigeration. Our heater in the triple room did not work. We reported it on our first night, but no one was there to fix it. The next morning the it was fixed. But night came, it would not work again. It was chilly (Dec 30 and 31) and we were not able to sleep well. Breakfast selection was good but the staff were not too friendly. The staff at the front desk were very kind. The elderly person even helped us print our boarding pass for free. This gesture made up for whatever was lacking in the hotel..

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay for vacation”
Reviews.Author: Arie H
Reviews.Content: We arrived this hotel on the evening for one night. The room we got was comfortable. The staff on that night was helpfull The hotel is situated near the central station. At night the area isn't attractive. We came again for another night at the end of our tour. This time we where very disapointed. We got a room at the 4th floor. No windows (only near the ceiling) There was no water pressure and in the morning no hot water. When I complained about it at the reception I got the answer that it can't be since no one else complained about it - so maybe I was imagening that we had no hot water and the cold water was only dripping from the tap. Since we had no windows I tried the aircondition. We didn't feel it either but got the same answer. The point of light in this hotel was the breakfast. The price is reasonable but one have to make sure that the room won't be on the 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; near train station”
Reviews.Author: ilovebeachgirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks quite lovely from the outside and in the lobby. Helpful staff. Free parking (limited to 4 cars). Within walking distance to Termini train/bus station. When we arrived we were given a room that had no air conditioning. I guess there are about 8 rooms that don't have air conditioning, but the rest of the hotel does. They allowed us to change rooms the next day that did have air conditioning, but you could barely tell since the hotel staff has control over the setting the temperature! The room we switched to was much bigger (could sleep at least 3 comfortably) and it had a bathtub!!! Out of the 10 different places we stayed in Italy, it was the only bathtub we ever saw! It rained one night and we were unable to close one of the windows. The rain poured in and drenched the carpet! Fortunately for us we were leaving that morning. I felt the room was somewhat expensive considering the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Cute for the price, wouldn't stay for more than a night...”
Reviews.Author: Cuban_lover83
Reviews.Content: I had to spend a night in Rome and needed a cheap hotel close to the train station. It was in walking distance from the train station. I was also able to walk to the fountain of trevi (a 30 minute walk) very easily. The hotel even gave me a map and plenty of tourist information. I booked the trip the day I was going to get there, and I didn't have any problems...they had my name down and were waiting for me when I arrived. I had a nice corner room, but the walls are a bit thin so I could hear everybody coming in and out of their rooms. Room was a decent size. The t.v. didn't work but I was only staying a night so I didn't bother complaining. The bathroom had really nice towels but I found a few hairs on the floor so I'm sure it wasn't cleaned too well. I wore flip flops in the shower because I wasn't too impressed with the cleanliness, but I have seen worse. The bed is always the most important part for me, and I have to say that I had no problems at all. The sheets were very clean, smelled fresh and the pillows were fluffy. I slept like a baby! Check-out was very easy because someone is always at the front desk. I left too early to take advantage of the free breakfast but I was told that the bar was open 24hrs. a day if I wanted to grab a cappuccino before leaving. All in all, I couldn't see myself staying there for a long time, but it was perfect for my one night in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with kind staff”
Reviews.Author: SJarrett5
Reviews.Content: My daughter (age 19) and I stayed at this hotel after deciding not to stay at a booked B&B that was close to the train station, Roma Termini. We booked this hotel by walking around the area near the B&B. They had rooms available at a reasonable price. The hotel was nice and quiet. They had free wi-fi which worked in our room as well as on 1st floor. The room was spacious and bathroom one of the largest we found on our trip from London, Rome, Venice, Milan, Paris, London, Cambridge. On our 2nd day, we had a train that left around 5:00 p.m., they let us leave our luggage in a locked room while we did the Vatican tour. When we got back, we were hot & sweaty and they let us take a quick shower in a vacant single room & then we got our luggage & left for the train station. They were very kind and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Close To Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Azmir
Reviews.Content: Late review, but we are really satisfied with what the hotel had offered, unless for the night shift receptionist who's a bit grumpy! :-) The hotel is nice and clean. Bathroom is a bit small. Close to everything. Breakfast is adequate. Maybe a bit costly to anybody who'd carry a currency lower than the Euros. What do you expect? This is Rome, pal! :-) Thanks to Filippo and the breakfast waiter, you've been a wonderful companion throughout our stay in Delle Rose. *In case you're wondering, I'm the Asian guy who always ask for hot water for my baby's milk :-) Read my blog www.sibulat.com for our trip to Rome & Venice, Chiao!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and well situated”
Reviews.Author: staybeautiful123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with a large group. It was conviniently situated near to Termini Station. The outside was beautiful and the lounge was spacious and comfortable. I stayed in a room with 2 friends on the ground floor. The room was clean and comfortable. It was on 2 floors (the bathroom, one bed and a writing desk on the ground floor and a flight of stairs leading up to a twin bedroom). We had no issues with the room, the beds (although camp beds) were fairly comfortable and the staff were polite and friendly, The breakfast was lovely, if a little carbohydrate based and lacking in fruit! I slept well although the bells from a nearby church woke me up every morning at 7am.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, dirty bird hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SERyckman
Reviews.Content: Don't let the charming, old outside appearance fool you. The hotel was very moldy and old smelling, probably because it was old and moldy. Please, don't stay here. If you go to the other side of the train station you'll find better value and nicer hotels. The breakfast made me and my friend, literally, vomit. Ye be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great room, good brekkie”
Reviews.Author: KarliReeves
Reviews.Content: We were really happy with our room at this hotel. Our room was spacious and had a gorgeous balcony. The train station is only about 500m away yet the hotel is hidden off the street in a quiet location. We were able to walk to all the major sights within Rome. The included breakfast is buffet style and the breakfast staff are fantastic. Overall we had a great stay here and would recommend it for short/long stays.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the City Location...Rome is gorgeous...”
Reviews.Author: miggy_2010
Reviews.Content: We joined a friend of ours on a trip to Rome and there was a large group of us. The hotel was perfect for location, value for money, clean, comfortable and a great pied a terre for discovering Rome. We had the opportunity to share romantic moments as a couple and wonderful banquets as a group, would definitely recommend a city break to Rome and this hotel is an ideal 3 star option. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “You cannot judge a book by its cover”
Reviews.Author: LorraineAustralia
Reviews.Content: After becoming excited about securing a room so close to Termini, upon entering it I was totally devastated. I expected something vaguely like what was pictured on the website. Instead I was the occupant of a nun's cell. Plain white walls, tiny room, nowhere to sit to watch the tv except sideways on the bed, a unclean bathroom fit for a child-size person and scruffy carpet with stains. To top it off I was constantly attacked by mosquitoes coming in through a window I could not shut. By morning I was glad to leave. I told the manager my thoughts and he explained that they were fully booked. This was of no relevance to my situation-I had booked 8months in advance! Beware solo travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for discovering Rome...”
Reviews.Author: johnssurrey
Reviews.Content: I was referred to this hotel by a friend who had stayed here through convenience, and on arrival at the main train station - Termini - from the airport via coach, we found its central location to be a winner. My friend had advised me that most of the hotel has already been through a room refurbishment, and our room was pleasantly one of these rooms - I am told that not too many more need refurb! Our room was spacious, clean and exactly what we wanted for our visit to Rome. The staff were polite, accommodating and attentive with further information regarding local 'non-tourist' focused restaurants and these were also real winners and NOT relatively expensive even though we are in the centre of a city...take a trip over to Trastevere and visit Taverna Trilussa. If I visit Rome again, I will definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and super clean”
Reviews.Author: mdhIndonesia
Reviews.Content: I am a bit surprised at some of the negative reviews and wonder about their age. Our family of 5 stayed there overnight recently as we came in from Venice on the train and were flying out the next day. The bathrooms in our two connecting rooms were brand new, the rooms were spotless, the beds and pillows were comfortable, the hot water was abundant in the shower/ bath ( good size bath too) and the air con was quiet and efficient. Our double room was small but welcome to Europe. The kids' triple connecting was really large. We were pleasantly surprised by the breakfast included in the price, which included cereals and freshly made eggs, and the staff were excessively polite. There was cable TV in each room and internet in the lounge. Only two drawbacks: our rooms had no windows to look out of except the ones up high on the wall for ventilation, and the area is really seedy, but we were there for the transport proximity and a good night's sleep. We got both. The price was fair. Give this one a go for a short comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A fraud, be very wary!”
Reviews.Author: Lineli
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with a number of colleagues for four nights. Judging from the website the hotel looked classy and pleasant. However, as soon as we came in, we noticed that the website is perhaps the only classy element of the hotel. The lobby is tired, the staff hardly speaks English, there is no internet connection in the room, ... However, this is nothing compared to the rooms and the breakfast. The rooms are just unpleasant, with marks on the walls, carpet and sheets, smelly carpets, pubic hair clinging to the shower curtains and a rather weird bathroom layout, making showering or just going to the toilet cumbersome. The breakfast was just sad: a limited choice, stale buns and yoghurt that had a very well developed mould culture growing on it. I know that not all rooms are as horrible as the ones we got, but as there is no way of knowing which room you will get (they all are priced the same), I would avoid this hotel all together.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great place (and location)”
Reviews.Author: rubi-IL
Reviews.Content: We arrived to rome for our honeymoon. The Hotel was very nice. The room was cleaned every day. During our vacation, the hotel's staff was very helpful for guiding us, as it was our first time in Italy. The breakfast was simple but rich. Always fresh with a wounderful attention and service. Thank you for making our honeymoon unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “Dark and Damp”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: I booked the Villa delle Rose online and was fooled by the pictures. The lobby needed a makeover and the room was small, dark and damp. The bathroom was tiny and not very comfortable. The bed was hard and the pillow was more like a flat tire. We stayed here because of its close proximity to Termini. My mistake. We won't be staying here again. I did, however, enjoy Daisy the cat who was always lounging on a couch in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great find, cool & quiet.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Taking blind from Internet I was more than happy with this place. It was hot in Rome but my room stayed cool. Street noise quieted down at night and even during the day was no worse than NYC. Breakfast service well stocked, good coffee. Plenty of hot water, very clean and well kept. English/French/Spanish speaking. In our party was one American, one French and one Scot and all would stay there again. More European than American style and most visitors were European. While Termini area is not the poshest, it was safe and access to the metro crossing and Airport train was nice at the end of a long day and getting to an early morning return flight that much easier.

Reviews.Title: “Paid more for less, but not for the tall or wide...”
Reviews.Author: Dominic271
Reviews.Content: I can forgive much about this hotel simply because of the small garden, particularly on a hot and sticky June evening (though there's not much to be done about neighbouring squabbling cats). Arriving after midnight, I was given a small back bedroom on the second floor, a floor which has obviously been subdivided with dropped ceilings, etc, to create a small number of large rooms, and a large number of small ones... Decor in the hotel is neutral/bland ('recently decorated', it says somewhere). The outside is a hymn to light brown paint, already peeling in the sun; the ground floor is okay, but there were mildew patches appearing on my bedroom wallpaper from the internal bathroom (positively the smallest bathroom I've ever been in). Bedroom contents: two single beds pushed together as a double (at 6'0", I tend to need something longer or end up sleeping at an angle); wardrobe of the undersized modern rickety school of design, but with hangers provided and a room safe that was replaced when the previous one failed to work. TV (Italian stations only) on a small desk (so therefore no room to use to desk), side chair, a bedside table nearing the end of its life, bedside lamp, phone. Plugs worked (helpful when you need to recharge a laptop). The air conditioning, left on all day, kept the temperature down and was quieter than in some 5 star hotels I've stayed in. Noisy floorboards in the room sounded ominous, but I didn't hear anything from the rooms on either side or upstairs, and street noise (apart from the occasional siren) was limited. The bathroom: shower (lots of hot water at good pressure), sink and WC. The WC's the most inconvenient part of the set-up, crammed between the sink and the shower. Another foot or so both ways would have helped. There are other and larger WCs on the ground floor. Overall: it just about worked for one person, but you wouldn't want to have two people in that room for any sustained period of time (then again, this is a hotel for people to sleep in, not to live in). Linen rather than terry towels: weird to begin with, but probably better given the humidity and replaced daily. The lift is tiny (but works fine), so you might as well take the stairs up and down unless you're carrying luggage. Receptionist English varies with the receptionist, but was adequate: an incoming message was passed on promptly and outgoing phone calls went through okay. Breakfast (perfectly adequate for setting you up for the day) is in a basement area with a slight smell of damp even in summer: suggest you ask for a tray to take into the garden instead. I didn't use the evening bar facilities. Location: Termini's not an area you're going to stroll through for a romantic evening, though I had a good quality, inexpensive meal in the trattoria just up the street and there are several of them around (Forget staying in a cheap hotel and eating in posh restaurants: the food I had locally was as good as anything I had elsewhere). But Termini is Termini: like most major rail stations, it attracts the good and bad, but it's definitely the best place to start visiting the city from (convenient for the Leonardo Express to and from Fiumicino, for the 110 city bus tour, for all the other buses, taxis and both Metro lines). And the new shopping centre at the station has great bookshops (there's also a string of secondhand bookstalls in the neighbouring piazza). Generally, the Delle Rose is a hotel that feels like it needs a good shake-up and some TLC to turn it into something better, with fewer small rooms. It "has been" a good hotel, according to friends in the Italian hotel industry, and it's probably not bad compared to others in the area, but the trick is obviously to ask for one of the larger rooms (there are a couple with a balcony), though I don't think the bathrooms get much bigger! Would I stay there again? Yes, given a limited budget and a choice of room.....

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is very near to station the area around hotel is not very nice. You will not want to walk in the area at night. The hotel itself is dirty. Looks like the carpets are never vaccuumed and they are coming off the floor. The rooms are dirty. The water glasses we were given had fungus on them. On positive side, the breakfast was good. It is possible to have your breakfast in garden full of roses. The hotel staff was very helpful and understood and spoke english very well. Overall not a very nice find. For the price we paid, I think we could have got a much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Look for another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel with a travel agency in Holland. They admitted they didn't really know this hotel. It is close to the railway, I give them that. The outside looks beautifull, with lots of flowers. Also lobby is great. But for the room, it was so small and dirty. Bathroom looked nice but was so small i couldn't turn around without hitting the toilet. Also, it was hot and there was no aircon. Asked the receptionist for a fan (he had one on the desk!) but said he didn't have one. He didn't speak any english (let alone dutch or german) and the staff was generally not helpfull or friendly. Awfull place to stay and noisy too. Me and my girlfriend we moved to the Jolly hotel which was cheaper and cleaner and better equipped. Staff there wasn't very friendly either, but we didn't need them that much.

Reviews.Title: “DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks great from the exterior and lobby. Don't be fooled, our room was a dump. We had to request a room change to a room that was only marginally better. room was filthy, carpets dirty in room and hallways. Bathroom was disgusting, scum and mold on sinks, shower and shower curtain. Would never stay here again. In fact, we cut our stay short (2 days) and checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: dnwilliams
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, just a block east of Terminin Train statiion entrance. Five minute walk from Termini Station entrance after arriving by train from airport. Rental cars avaiable on our side of Termini Station. Hotel lobby faces courtyard where walls afforded a quiet place to relax. Off-street parking a bit limited, but not many guests had cars. We were able to park our rental car in area provided. Owner and his staff were very cheerful. Room and facilities very clean, comfortable and free of street noise.

HotelInfo.Name: Villa Delle Rose Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Vicenza 5, 00185 Rome, Italy
